Death's uncontrollable summons; or, The mortality of mankind. Being a dialogue between death and a young-man. To the tune of, My bleeding heart.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Pye-corner., [London] : [1685]
Verse: "In slumber and sleep my senses fail'd ..." Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. Trimmed. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
